intro: [WRONG START] Hieracussion valdeonense, commonly known as the Valdeonense hawkweed, is a perennial flowering plant native to specific regions of Europe. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble small daisies. The plant produces yellow to orange flowers, which bloom in late summer and early autumn. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Hieracium valdeonense is often found in meadows and grasslands, where it thrives in well-drained soils.
